snippet: More states are making the case against capital punishment with the support of new studies showing gross injustice and enormous costs.
abstract: Editorial maintains capital punishment must be abolished in the United States; notes Connecticut is poised to become the 17th state without the death penalty and the fifth in five years to abolish it; says growing movement against capital punishment comes at a time when analyses of the practice show gross injustice in its application and enormous costs in continuing to impose it.
lead_paragraph: More states are making the case against capital punishment with the support of new studies showing gross injustice and enormous costs.
